newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Casablanca bourse keeps steady rise.
newsitem.headline: Casablanca bourse keeps steady rise.

text.p: The Casablanca stock exchange closed on Monday 0.51 percent higher led by the banking sector and ONA group, brokers said.
The all-share index closed at 454.21 points from 451.90 points on Friday.
ONA group jumped 16 dirhams to close at 557 dirhams.
Banque Marocaine du Commerce Exterieur was up three dirhams to 408 dirhams.
Centrale Laitiere, a subsidiary of ONA group, jumped 40 dirhams to close at 1860 dirhams. French goup Danone has a 20 percent stake in the dairy firm.
Credit firm Eqdom Credit, which announced a capital increase recently, was up 23 dirhams to close at 785 dirhams.
Eqdom, Morocco's first consumer credit company, was set up in 1974 by holding company Societe Nationale d'Investissement and major insurance companies.
Samir refinery, Morocco's main oil plant in which Morocco plans to sell 31 percent to 51 percent to foreign investors, remained unchanged at 243 dirhams.
Societe Nationale d'Investissement, the second largest conglomerate, closed unchanged at 550 dirhams.
Traded volume on the official market was 22.1 million from 35.4 million dirhams on Friday.
